column5: In the end, it likely wasn't anywhere close to 20lbs...I never weigh any fish, but I'd say it's around 15 . The excitement really gets to you! My biggest for sure so far. It's a very cool thing to see the fish swimming around at your feet through the clear solid ice.  Pic doesn't do it justice   Release. 8" hole.   We did well and ended up with lots of fish on the ice, but also lost ridiculous numbers of fish bringing them up as well.               Just wanted to share
Wow great picks loved it, Thanks for sharing
awesome pics!
Lakers are on. Way to go.
Awesome!
That's phenomenal....good job out there!
That's some nice fish,and not to far  from shore, :whistling:lol.
very nice ! awesome pictures !
great day and a couple tanks, trying to get out on simcoe this weekend just can't decide between perchin or lakers
Outstanding report....great pics....really enjoyed that!
Love the photos, and love the bucktail stinger rig.  I'll have to do some experimenting with hair jigs once lakers finally open up here....
Great day. Soon as things get cold again, I'm out there.
Nice!
Nice fish.  Love your pix!
Thanks for sharing, nice pictures! That's an odd looking bucktail, I'm sure it was just a fluke that the lure caught so many fish.
great photos beauty lakers bud! did you tie those bucktails?
Nice fish!  Looking forward to getting out there myself.
Great report!  Love the video and seeing that brute swimming under the ice before you landed it.
Thanks for the comments guys!   Nope... I hope to start tying them one day though.
Finally got to watch the vid. Superb. Real nice fish Anthony.  Great photos.
